references.reason: This paper introduces Wasserstein GAN, a significant advancement in generative adversarial networks, which is foundational to many generative models used in this work.
This seminal paper introduces the concept of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a fundamental technique in deep learning that has applications in data augmentation.
This work is fundamental to the Variational Autoencoder (VAE) approach, another common generative model used in data augmentation.

references.paper_title: Progressive distillation for fast sampling of diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents an important technique in diffusion models that enables faster and more efficient data generation, improving training efficiency.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised representation learning with deep convolutional generative adversarial networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks (DCGANs), another significant architecture that is relevant to this work.
